page.title: 13THE BLOCKWORKS, UFFCULME
page.content: The Blockworks was purchased from {Andrews and Miller,}a local firm, by {E.C.C.}in{1976.}In{1982}it was rebuilt and at this time was one of the most modern plants of its kind in Europe. It can produce up to 200 000 blocks per week. There are{sixty different {types of block produced}with varying strengths and finishes. Most of the blocks produced are sold in the local area but some of the more specialised ones go as far afield as{London. {Sixteen people are employed}on the production side and a further{twelve {are employed}to deliver the blocks on the firms own lorries with cranes for loading and unloading the 'stacks' of blocks. No lorries now go through Uffculme unless delivering there. Apart from pumice,used in some blocks, and cement, all materials come from E.C.C.'s adjacent{Hillhead Quarry.
